Title: Verify Empty Loads Creation (Prerequisites)
Description:
1. Login to the application
2. Navigate to job file
3. Create empty loads
4. Verify loads are created successfully
Preconditions: - User has valid credentials\n- User has permission to create loads\n- Domestic workflow is available
Expected Result: Empty loads are created successfully and displayed in the load management screen. Load IDs are generated and visible.
Tags: PB-3176, Prerequisites, Domestic Workflow

Title: Verify Select Orders Navigation from Import Drawer
Description:
1. Open job file with empty loads
2. Click on Import Orders drawer/button
3. Select 'Select Orders' option
4. Verify navigation occurs
Preconditions: - Empty loads are created\n- User is on job file page\n- Order Manager is accessible
Expected Result: User is successfully redirected to Order Manager screen where existing orders can be browsed and selected.
Tags: PB-3176, Import Orders, Navigation

Title: Verify Order File Upload and Registration
Description:
1. Open Import Orders drawer
2. Click 'Import Orders' option
3. Select valid order file from file system
4. Click Upload/Import button
5. Wait for processing
6. Verify orders appear in job file
7. Navigate to Order Manager
8. Verify same orders are registered in Order Manager
Preconditions: - Empty loads exist\n- Valid order file is available (correct format)\n- File contains at least 5 orders
Expected Result:
- Orders are successfully imported to job file
- Orders are displayed in Import Orders section
- Same orders are automatically registered in Order Manager
- No error messages are displayed
- Order count matches file content
Tags: PB-3176, Import Orders, File Upload, Order Manager

Title: Verify Duplicate Order Detection Warning
Description:
1. Import orders via file upload (e.g., orders O-001, O-002, O-003)
2. Verify orders are in Order Manager
3. Attempt to upload the same order file again
4. Observe warning popup
5. Verify popup message content
6. Click OK/Close on popup
7. Verify duplicate orders are not added
Preconditions: - Orders already exist in Order Manager from previous upload\n- Same order file is available for re-upload
Expected Result:
- Warning popup appears immediately after upload attempt
- Popup displays message: 'These orders are already in the system and will be omitted from the upload'
- Duplicate orders are not imported
- Order count in job file remains unchanged
- Order Manager shows no duplicate entries
Tags: PB-3176, Validation, Duplicate Detection, Error Handling

Title: Verify Clear Orders - Yes Option (Remove from Both)
Description:
1. Import orders to job file (at least 3 orders)
2. Verify orders exist in Import Orders section
3. Verify orders exist in Order Manager
4. Click 'Clear Orders' button
5. Observe confirmation popup
6. Click 'Yes' button
7. Verify orders removed from job file
8. Navigate to Order Manager
9. Verify orders removed from Order Manager
Preconditions: - Orders are imported in job file\n- Same orders exist in Order Manager\n- Clear Orders button is visible and enabled
Expected Result:
- Confirmation popup appears with message: 'Do you want to remove these orders from the order manager as well'
- Popup has Yes and No buttons
- After clicking Yes, orders are removed from job file Import Orders section
- Orders are also removed from Order Manager
- Confirmation message: 'Orders removed successfully'
Tags: PB-3176, Clear Orders, Data Management, Order Manager Sync

Title: Verify Clear Orders - No Option (Remove from Job Only)
Description:
1. Import orders to job file (at least 3 orders)
2. Verify orders exist in Import Orders section
3. Note order IDs for verification
4. Click 'Clear Orders' button
5. Observe confirmation popup
6. Click 'No' button
7. Verify orders removed from job file
8. Navigate to Order Manager
9. Verify orders still exist in Order Manager
Preconditions: - Orders are imported in job file\n- Same orders exist in Order Manager\n- Clear Orders button is visible and enabled
Expected Result:
- Confirmation popup appears with message: 'Do you want to remove these orders from the order manager as well'
- After clicking No, orders are removed from job file only
- Import Orders section is empty in job file
- Orders remain visible and accessible in Order Manager
- Order Manager count is unchanged
Tags: PB-3176, Clear Orders, Data Management, Order Manager Sync

Title: Verify Move Orders Button Enable on Selection
Description:
1. Import orders to job file (at least 5 orders)
2. Verify Move Orders button initial state (should be disabled)
3. Click checkbox to select one order
4. Verify Move Orders button is enabled
5. Select 2 more orders (total 3 selected)
6. Verify button remains enabled
7. Deselect all orders
8. Verify button is disabled again
Preconditions: - Multiple orders are available in Import Orders section\n- Move Orders button is visible\n- Orders are selectable via checkbox
Expected Result:
- Move Orders button is initially disabled (grayed out)
- Button becomes enabled immediately when at least one order is selected
- Button remains enabled for multiple selections
- Button returns to disabled state when all orders are deselected
- Visual state change is clear (color, cursor change)
Tags: PB-3176, Move Orders, UI Interaction, Button State

Title: Verify Orders Transfer to Selected Load
Description:
1. Import orders to job file (orders O-100, O-101, O-102)
2. Create/verify empty loads exist (Load-1, Load-2, Load-3)
3. Select orders O-100 and O-101
4. Click Move Orders button
5. Observe Load selection window/popup
6. Click on Load-2
7. Verify orders are transferred
8. Expand Load-2 in load management
9. Verify orders O-100 and O-101 appear in Load-2
Preconditions: - Multiple orders are available\n- At least 2 empty loads exist\n- Move Orders button is functional
Expected Result:
- Load selection window appears showing all existing load IDs
- Clicking Load-2 transfers selected orders
- Orders disappear from Import Orders section
- Orders appear in Load-2 activities
- Load-2 now shows 2 orders
- Orders are displayed as chips with order IDs
Tags: PB-3176, Move Orders, Load Management, Order Transfer

Title: Verify Automatic Location-Based Grouping
Description:
1. Prepare orders with different locations:
   - O-200: Location A
   - O-201: Location B
   - O-202: Location A
   - O-203: Location C
2. Select all 4 orders
3. Move orders to Load-5
4. Expand Load-5 activities
5. Verify orders are grouped by location
6. Verify grouping structure
Preconditions: - Orders have location data assigned\n- Multiple orders with same and different locations exist\n- Target load is empty
Expected Result:
- Orders are automatically grouped by location
- Location A group contains O-200 and O-202
- Location B group contains O-201
- Location C group contains O-203
- Each location appears only once as activity
- Orders maintain their selection sequence within each location group
Tags: PB-3176, Location Sequencing, Auto-Grouping, Business Logic

Title: Verify Existing Location Handling in Load
Description:
1. Move order O-300 (Location X) to Load-7
2. Verify Location X activity is created in Load-7
3. Move order O-301 (Location Y) to Load-7
4. Verify Location Y activity is created
5. Now move order O-302 (Location X) to Load-7
6. Verify order O-302 goes to existing Location X group
Preconditions: - Target load has some locations with orders\n- New order has same location as existing activity
Expected Result:
- Order O-302 is not creating a new Location X activity
- Order O-302 is added to existing Location X group
- Order O-302 appears alongside O-300 in Location X
- Location sequence is maintained
- No duplicate location activities exist
Tags: PB-3176, Location Sequencing, Smart Grouping, Edge Cases

Title: Verify Remove Order Chip from Activity
Description:
1. Navigate to Load Management screen
2. Expand load with orders (e.g., Load-10 with orders O-400, O-401, O-402)
3. Locate activity card with order chips
4. Identify order chip O-401
5. Click remove/close icon on O-401 chip
6. Verify chip is removed
7. Navigate to Import Orders section
8. Verify O-401 appears in All Orders
Preconditions: - Load has orders assigned to activities\n- Activity card is expandable\n- Orders are displayed as removable chips with close icons
Expected Result:
- Order chip O-401 has visible remove icon (X or close icon)
- Clicking remove icon removes the chip from activity
- Order O-401 no longer appears in Load-10
- Order O-401 appears in Import Orders section (All Orders)
- Order is available for reassignment
- No errors occur during removal
Tags: PB-3176, Load Management, Order Removal, Data Flow

Title: Verify Move Orders Between Loads in Update Drawer
Description:
1. Create Load-20 with orders O-500, O-501, O-502
2. Create Load-21 with orders O-503, O-504
3. Click Update Loads button
4. Verify Update Loads drawer opens
5. Expand Load-20
6. Select orders O-500 and O-501
7. Click Move button
8. Select Load-21 from load selection window
9. Verify orders are moved
10. Verify Load-20 now has only O-502
11. Verify Load-21 now has O-503, O-504, O-500, O-501
Preconditions: - Multiple loads exist with orders\n- Update Loads button is visible\n- Loads are accessible in drawer
Expected Result:
- Update Loads drawer opens with all load IDs
- Loads are expandable in drawer
- Expanded load shows order IDs
- Orders can be selected via checkboxes
- Move button appears and is enabled when orders selected
- Load selection window shows all available loads
- Orders are successfully transferred from Load-20 to Load-21
- Source load updates order count
- Target load updates order count and displays new orders
Tags: PB-3176, Update Loads, Order Transfer, Load Management

Title: Verify Load Details Display in Update Drawer
Description:
1. Create multiple loads with different configurations:
   - Load-30: Vehicle Type: Truck, CBM: 25.5, Weight: 5000kg
   - Load-31: Vehicle Type: Van, CBM: 15.0, Weight: 2500kg
2. Click Update Loads button
3. Open Update Loads drawer
4. Verify Load-30 details displayed
5. Verify Load-31 details displayed
Preconditions: - Loads have vehicle type, CBM, and weight data configured\n- Update Loads functionality is accessible
Expected Result:
For each load in drawer, verify following details are displayed:
- Load ID (e.g., Load-30, Load-31)
- Vehicle Type (e.g., Truck, Van)
- CBM value with decimal precision (e.g., 25.5, 15.0)
- Weight in kg (e.g., 5000kg, 2500kg)
- All data is clearly labeled and formatted
- Data matches load configuration
Tags: PB-3176, Update Loads, Data Display, UI

Title: Verify Optimization Counter Display and Increment
Description:
1. Create new job file
2. Verify optimization counter shows 0
3. Create loads with orders
4. Click global Optimise button
5. Confirm optimization (click Yes)
6. Wait for optimization to complete
7. Verify counter increments to 1
8. Perform another optimization on single load
9. Verify counter increments to 2
10. Perform multiple optimizations
11. Verify counter continues to increment
Preconditions: - Fresh job file or counter reset to 0\n- Loads with orders exist\n- Optimization functionality is available
Expected Result:
- Optimization counter is visible in UI (possibly in header or summary area)
- Initial count is 0 for new job
- Counter increments by 1 after each optimization
- Counter updates immediately after optimization completes
- Counter persists when navigating away and back
- Counter accurately reflects total optimizations performed
Tags: PB-3176, Route Optimization, Counter, UI Feedback

Title: Verify Route Optimizer Logic - Lowest Mileage
Description:
1. Create Load-40 with orders at multiple locations:
   - Depot (start)
   - Location A: 20km from depot
   - Location B: 15km from A or 30km from depot directly
   - Location C: 10km from B
2. Configure route so multiple paths exist
3. Click Optimise button for Load-40
4. Verify route selected
5. Calculate total mileage
6. Verify optimizer chose lowest mileage route
Preconditions: - Test environment has location data with distances\n- Multiple route options exist with different mileages\n- Location accessibility and operating hours are configured but should be ignored
Expected Result:
- Optimizer analyzes all possible routes
- Optimizer selects route with absolute lowest total kilometers
- Optimizer DOES NOT consider location accessibility constraints
- Optimizer DOES NOT consider operating hours
- Optimizer DOES NOT consider time windows
- Route selection is purely based on lowest KM metric
- Optimization result displays total mileage
Tags: PB-3176, Route Optimization, Business Logic, Algorithm

Title: Verify Global Optimize Button with Confirmation
Description:
1. Create job with multiple loads (Load-50, Load-51, Load-52)
2. Add orders to each load
3. Locate global Optimise button in job file
4. Click Optimise button
5. Observe confirmation popup
6. Verify popup message and buttons
7. Click Yes
8. Verify all loads are optimized
9. Repeat test and click No
10. Verify optimization is cancelled
Preconditions: - Multiple loads with orders exist in job file\n- Global Optimise button is visible and enabled
Expected Result:
- Global Optimise button is clearly visible in job file interface
- Clicking button triggers warning popup before optimization
- Popup displays message: 'Are you sure you want to optimise these loads?'
- Popup has Yes and No buttons
- Clicking Yes optimizes all loads in job file (Load-50, Load-51, Load-52)
- Clicking No cancels operation and closes popup
- No optimization occurs when No is clicked
Tags: PB-3176, Route Optimization, Global Optimization, User Confirmation

Title: Verify Per-Load Optimization Isolation
Description:
1. Create three loads:
   - Load-60: Orders O-600, O-601, O-602 (not optimized)
   - Load-61: Orders O-603, O-604 (not optimized)
   - Load-62: Orders O-605, O-606, O-607 (not optimized)
2. Note initial route sequences for all loads
3. Click Optimise button on Load-61 only
4. Wait for optimization to complete
5. Verify Load-61 route is optimized
6. Verify Load-60 route remains unchanged
7. Verify Load-62 route remains unchanged
Preconditions: - Multiple loads with different order sequences exist\n- Each load has individual Optimise button\n- Loads have non-optimized routes initially
Expected Result:
- Each load has its own Optimise button (not just global)
- Clicking Optimise on Load-61 processes only Load-61
- Load-61 route sequence changes (if optimization found better route)
- Load-60 route sequence remains exactly as it was
- Load-62 route sequence remains exactly as it was
- Only Load-61 optimization counter increments
- No impact on other loads confirmed
Tags: PB-3176, Route Optimization, Per-Load Optimization, Isolation

Title: Verify Button Icon Replacements
Description:
1. Navigate to load management screen
2. Locate a load card
3. Identify existing buttons: Edit Load Data, Duplicate, Delete
4. Verify buttons are now displayed as icons
5. Hover over each icon
6. Verify tooltips appear
Preconditions: - Load management screen is accessible\n- Loads exist in the system\n- UI updates have been applied
Expected Result:
- Edit Load Data is now an icon (e.g., pencil/edit icon)
- Duplicate is now an icon (e.g., copy icon)
- Delete is now an icon (e.g., trash/delete icon)
- Icons are clearly recognizable
- Icons have appropriate tooltips on hover
- Icons maintain same functionality as previous buttons
- UI is cleaner and more modern
Tags: PB-3176, UI Modernization, Icon Replacement, UX

Title: Verify New Action Buttons with Tooltips
Description:
1. Navigate to load management screen
2. Locate a load card
3. Identify three new buttons: Optimise, Update Load, Import Orders
4. Hover over Optimise button
5. Verify tooltip displays 'Optimise'
6. Click Optimise button and verify it optimizes the load
7. Hover over Update Load button
8. Verify tooltip displays 'Update Load'
9. Click Update Load and verify it opens update orders screen
10. Hover over Import Orders button
11. Verify tooltip displays 'Import Orders'
12. Click Import Orders and verify it opens import drawer
Preconditions: - Load cards are displayed in load management\n- New buttons have been added\n- Tooltips are configured
Expected Result:
Three new buttons are present on each load:
1. Optimise button:
   - Button is visible and styled appropriately
   - Tooltip shows 'Optimise' on hover
   - Clicking button optimizes that specific load route
2. Update Load button:
   - Button is visible
   - Tooltip shows 'Update Load' on hover
   - Clicking button opens update orders screen for that load
3. Import Orders button:
   - Button is visible
   - Tooltip shows 'Import Orders' on hover
   - Clicking button opens import orders drawer
All tooltips appear within 0.5 seconds of hover
Tags: PB-3176, New Features, UI Controls, Tooltips, UX

Title: Verify Duplicate Load Excludes Orders
Description:
1. Create Load-70 with:
   - Location A with orders O-700, O-701
   - Location B with order O-702
   - Location C with orders O-703, O-704, O-705
2. Note load structure and order count (6 orders)
3. Click Duplicate icon/button on Load-70
4. Verify new load is created (Load-71 or similar)
5. Expand Load-71
6. Verify locations are present
7. Verify orders are NOT present
Preconditions: - Load with multiple locations and orders exists\n- Duplicate button/icon is functional
Expected Result:
- Duplicate action creates new load (Load-71)
- Load-71 contains all locations: Location A, B, C
- Load-71 has same location sequence as Load-70
- Load-71 has NO orders in any location
- Location A is empty (no O-700, O-701)
- Location B is empty (no O-702)
- Location C is empty (no O-703, O-704, O-705)
- Load structure is preserved but orders are excluded
- Original Load-70 remains unchanged
Tags: PB-3176, Duplicate Load, Data Exclusion, Business Logic

Title: Verify Delete Load Confirmation Flow
Description:
1. Navigate to load management with Load-80
2. Click Delete icon on Load-80
3. Observe warning popup
4. Verify popup message: 'Are you sure you want to delete this load?'
5. Verify Yes and No buttons are present
6. Click No button
7. Verify popup closes and load remains
8. Click Delete icon again
9. Click Yes button
10. Verify load is deleted
Preconditions: - Load-80 exists with or without orders\n- Delete button/icon is accessible
Expected Result:
Test scenario 1 (No button):
- Warning popup appears with correct message
- Popup has Yes and No buttons
- Clicking No closes popup
- Load-80 is NOT deleted
- Load-80 remains visible in load management

Test scenario 2 (Yes button):
- Clicking Yes deletes Load-80
- Load-80 is removed from load management screen
- Confirmation message appears: 'Load deleted successfully'
- If load had orders, orders should return to Import Orders section
Tags: PB-3176, Delete Load, Confirmation Dialog, Destructive Action

Title: Verify Single Order Deletion Edge Case
Description:
1. Create Load-90 with Location P
2. Add only ONE order (O-900) to Location P unloading activity
3. Expand Load-90 and Location P activity
4. Click remove icon on order chip O-900
5. Observe warning popup
6. Verify popup message: 'Do you want to delete the activity along with the order'
7. Verify three buttons: Yes, No, Cancel
8. Hover over Yes button - verify tooltip
9. Hover over No button - verify tooltip
10. Test each button action
Preconditions: - Load has activity with exactly ONE order\n- Order is in unloading activity\n- Remove icon is functional
Expected Result:
Warning popup appears with message: 'Do you want to delete the activity along with the order'
Three buttons present:

1. Yes button:
   - Hover tooltip: 'This option will delete both the activity and the order'
   - Clicking Yes removes both activity card (Location P) and order O-900
   - Order O-900 goes to Import Orders section

2. No button:
   - Hover tooltip: 'This option will delete the order only'
   - Clicking No removes only order O-900
   - Location P activity card remains (empty)
   - Order O-900 goes to Import Orders section

3. Cancel button:
   - Clicking Cancel closes popup
   - No changes occur
   - Order O-900 remains in activity
Tags: PB-3176, Edge Cases, Order Deletion, Activity Management, Tooltips

Title: Verify Order Manager Synchronization
Description:
1. Import 5 orders via file upload to job
2. Verify all 5 orders appear in Order Manager
3. Move 2 orders to Load-100
4. Verify Order Manager still shows all 5 orders
5. Clear 2 orders from job (No option - keep in Order Manager)
6. Verify Order Manager shows 5 orders
7. Clear 1 order with Yes option (remove from both)
8. Verify Order Manager now shows 4 orders
9. Delete an order from activity
10. Verify Order Manager remains consistent
Preconditions: - Order Manager is accessible\n- Import and Clear functionality work\n- Multiple operations can be performed
Expected Result:
- Initial upload syncs orders to Order Manager
- Moving orders between loads does NOT remove from Order Manager
- Clearing orders with 'No' keeps orders in Order Manager
- Clearing orders with 'Yes' removes from Order Manager
- Deleting order from activity returns it to Import Orders but keeps in Order Manager
- Order Manager count is always accurate
- No duplicate orders exist
- Data integrity is maintained across all operations
Tags: PB-3176, Integration, Order Manager, Data Sync, Data Integrity

Title: Verify Figma Design Compliance
Description:
1. Access Figma design: https://www.figma.com/proto/V3UtmFSpcSHqzVCVcDyp3D/Import-orders?node-id=1-6
2. Review Import Orders drawer design
3. Compare with implemented UI
4. Verify button placements match Figma
5. Verify colors match design system
6. Verify spacing and alignment
7. Verify typography (fonts, sizes)
8. Verify icons match Figma
9. Verify responsive behavior
Preconditions: - Figma design is accessible\n- Implementation is complete\n- Design specs are available
Expected Result:
- Import Orders drawer layout matches Figma exactly
- Select Orders and Import Orders options positioned per design
- Button styles (color, size, border radius) match Figma
- Icon styles and sizes match Figma
- Spacing between elements matches design (padding, margins)
- Typography (font family, size, weight) matches design system
- Colors match design tokens/variables
- Hover states match Figma interactions
- Overall UI is pixel-perfect to design
Tags: PB-3176, Figma, Design Compliance, UI Validation

Title: Verify Large Order File Upload Performance
Description:
1. Prepare order file with 500 orders
2. Start upload and note start time
3. Monitor upload progress
4. Note completion time
5. Verify all 500 orders are imported
6. Verify Order Manager registration
7. Test UI responsiveness during upload
8. Repeat with 1000 orders
Preconditions: - Large order files are available (500, 1000 orders)\n- File format is valid\n- System has adequate resources
Expected Result:
- File with 500 orders uploads within 30 seconds
- File with 1000 orders uploads within 60 seconds
- Progress indicator shows upload status
- UI remains responsive during upload
- No browser freeze or crash
- All orders are accurately imported
- Order Manager syncs within reasonable time
- No memory leaks occur
- System handles large datasets efficiently
Tags: PB-3176, Performance, Large Dataset, Scalability

Title: Verify Multiple Loads Optimization Performance
Description:
1. Create 20 loads each with 15 orders (300 total orders)
2. Configure complex location relationships
3. Click global Optimise button
4. Note start time
5. Monitor optimization progress
6. Note completion time
7. Verify all loads are optimized
8. Check optimization results for accuracy
Preconditions: - 20 loads with 15 orders each exist\n- Complex location data is configured\n- Optimization algorithm is functional
Expected Result:
- Optimization of 20 loads completes within 3 minutes
- Progress indicator shows optimization status
- UI remains responsive during optimization
- User can cancel optimization if needed
- All 20 loads show optimized routes
- Route calculations are accurate
- No timeout errors occur
- System handles optimization at scale
- Optimization counter increments correctly to 1 (for global optimization)
Tags: PB-3176, Performance, Optimization, Scalability, Load Testing

Title: Verify Accessibility - Screen Reader Support
Description:
1. Enable screen reader (JAWS, NVDA, or VoiceOver)
2. Navigate to Import Orders drawer
3. Tab through all interactive elements
4. Verify screen reader announces each element
5. Test action buttons and confirm announcements
6. Verify tooltips are read aloud
7. Test error messages are announced
Preconditions: - Screen reader software is installed\n- User has accessibility testing knowledge\n- All features are accessible
Expected Result:
- Screen reader announces button labels correctly
- Interactive elements are in logical tab order
- Tooltips are announced on focus
- Action confirmations are read aloud
- Error messages are accessible
- ARIA labels are properly implemented
Tags: PB-3176, Accessibility, Screen Reader

Title: Verify Error Handling - Invalid File Format
Description:
1. Navigate to Import Orders
2. Select file with invalid format (.txt, .pdf)
3. Attempt to upload
4. Verify error message displays
5. Verify file is rejected
6. Test with partially corrupt file
7. Verify appropriate error message
Preconditions: - Import Orders functionality is available\n- Invalid format files are available for testing
Expected Result:
- Error message displays: 'Invalid file format'
- Only valid formats (.csv, .xlsx) are accepted
- User is guided to correct format
- Upload is prevented for invalid files
- Partially corrupt files are detected
- Error messages are clear and actionable
Tags: PB-3176, Error Handling, Validation

Title: Verify Error Handling - Network Failure During Upload
Description:
1. Start order file upload
2. Simulate network disconnection mid-upload
3. Verify error handling
4. Restore network connection
5. Verify resume or retry option
6. Complete upload
7. Verify data integrity
Preconditions: - Network simulation tools available\n- Order file ready for upload\n- System has error recovery mechanisms
Expected Result:
- System detects network failure gracefully
- User is notified of connection loss
- Retry or resume option is available
- No partial data corruption occurs
- Upload completes successfully after retry
- All orders are imported correctly
- System maintains data integrity
Tags: PB-3176, Error Handling, Network Resilience

Title: Verify Error Handling - Optimization Failure
Description:
1. Create load with invalid location data
2. Attempt route optimization
3. Verify system handles failure gracefully
4. Check error message clarity
5. Verify system remains stable
6. Test recovery options
7. Fix data and retry optimization
Preconditions: - Load with problematic data exists\n- Optimization can be triggered\n- Error handling is implemented
Expected Result:
- System detects optimization failure
- Clear error message is displayed
- System does not crash or freeze
- User can dismiss error and continue
- Recovery options are provided
- Logs capture error details
- Retry after fixing data succeeds
Tags: PB-3176, Error Handling, Optimization

Title: Verify Order Display Limit per Load
Description:
1. Create load
2. Add 15 orders to load
3. View load activity card
4. Verify first 10 orders are visible
5. Verify scroll bar appears for remaining orders
6. Scroll through all orders
7. Verify all 15 orders are accessible
Preconditions: - Load can accommodate 15+ orders\n- Orders can be added to load\n- Display limit is configured at 10
Expected Result:
- First 10 orders are displayed initially
- Scroll bar appears for orders beyond 10
- All 15 orders are accessible via scroll
- Performance remains smooth with many orders
- Order IDs are clearly visible
- Scroll behavior is intuitive
Tags: PB-3176, Display Limit, UI Performance

Title: Verify File Import Performance
Description:
1. Prepare order file
2. Start import timer
3. Upload file
4. Monitor import progress
5. Record completion time
6. Verify import completes within 5 seconds
7. Validate all data imported correctly
Preconditions: - Order file with valid data ready\n- Timer or performance monitoring tool available\n- System meets performance requirements
Expected Result:
- File import starts immediately
- Progress indicator shows import status
- Import completes within 5 seconds
- All orders are imported correctly
- No data loss or corruption
- System remains responsive during import
- Performance meets specification
Tags: PB-3176, Performance, Import Speed

Title: Verify Optimization Performance Time Limit
Description:
1. Create complex job with 20 loads and 300 orders
2. Start optimization timer
3. Click Optimise button
4. Monitor optimization progress
5. Record completion time
6. Verify optimization completes within 2-3 minutes
7. Validate optimization results accuracy
Preconditions: - Complex job with 20 loads and 300 orders exists\n- Timer available\n- Optimization functionality is operational
Expected Result:
- Optimization process starts immediately
- Progress indicator shows optimization status
- Optimization completes within 2-3 minutes
- All loads are optimized correctly
- Results are accurate and valid
- System remains stable during optimization
- Performance meets business requirements
Tags: PB-3176, Performance, Optimization Time

Title: Verify Multiple Loading Locations Validation
Description:
1. Prepare order file with orders having multiple pickup locations
2. Attempt to upload file
3. Verify validation error message
4. Verify orders are rejected
5. Test with single pickup location
6. Verify single location orders are accepted
Preconditions: - Order files with multiple and single pickup locations available\n- Validation rules are configured\n- System enforces business rules
Expected Result:
- Orders with multiple pickup locations are rejected
- Error message states: 'Multiple loading locations not supported by optimizer'
- Orders with single pickup location are accepted
- Validation occurs during upload
- User is clearly informed of rejection reason
- Business rule is enforced consistently
Tags: PB-3176, Validation, Business Rules

Title: Verify Pickup Delivery Time Calculation
Description:
1. Create load with multiple locations
2. Add order with pickup time specified
3. Verify first location uses order pickup time
4. Check subsequent location times
5. Verify times are calculated per current behavior
6. Validate time progression logic
Preconditions: - Load with multiple locations exists\n- Orders have pickup time data\n- Time calculation logic is implemented
Expected Result:
- First location pickup time matches order pickup time
- Subsequent location times are calculated automatically
- Time progression is logical and consistent
- Calculation follows current system behavior
- No time conflicts or overlaps
- Times account for travel duration
- Delivery times are realistic
Tags: PB-3176, Business Logic, Time Calculation

Title: Verify Re-upload Prevention
Description:
1. Import orders to job file
2. Verify orders exist in job
3. Attempt to re-upload same orders
4. Verify system prevents re-upload
5. Check error or warning message
6. Validate data integrity maintained
Preconditions: - Orders already imported in job\n- Same order file available for re-upload attempt\n- Validation logic is implemented
Expected Result:
- System detects orders already exist in job
- Re-upload is prevented
- Warning message displayed: 'Orders already exist in this job'
- No duplicate orders are created
- Existing orders remain unchanged
- Data integrity is maintained
- User is clearly informed
Tags: PB-3176, Validation, Data Integrity

Title: Verify Starting Location Selection
Description:
1. Create load with orders
2. Identify pickup location in orders
3. Run route optimization
4. Verify pickup location is used as starting point
5. Check route begins from pickup location
6. Validate optimization logic
Preconditions: - Load with orders and pickup locations exists\n- Optimization functionality is available\n- Pickup locations are properly configured
Expected Result:
- Pickup location is automatically identified as starting location
- Route optimization begins from pickup location
- First activity in optimized route is pickup
- Starting location selection is correct
- Business rule is enforced
- Route makes logical sense from starting point
Tags: PB-3176, Business Logic, Route Optimization

Title: Verify Order File Format Validation
Description:
1. Prepare order file with all mandatory fields (CBM, SKU, kg)
2. Upload file
3. Verify file is accepted
4. Remove one mandatory field (e.g., CBM)
5. Attempt upload
6. Verify validation error
7. Verify error message specifies missing field
Preconditions: - Order files with complete and incomplete data available\n- File format validation is implemented\n- Mandatory fields: CBM, SKU, kg
Expected Result:
- File with all mandatory fields is accepted
- File missing CBM is rejected with error
- File missing SKU is rejected with error
- File missing kg is rejected with error
- Error messages clearly specify which field is missing
- File format requirements are enforced
- User is guided to correct file format
Tags: PB-3176, Validation, File Format
